design_audit.model_formula: Exp_adeq ~ Carbs_adeq + Prot_md + Prot_p + Prot_veg + Fat_md + Fat_p + Fat_veg + catXqtr_dummies | hhcat_FE, cluster(hhcat)
design_audit.selection_story: Household food demand estimation: expenditure per adult equivalent regressed on nutrient quantities (carbs, protein by meat-dairy/prepared/other, fat by same groups) with household-by-category FE and category-by-quarter dummies. IV uses neighborhood average nutrient attributes as instruments for endogenous nutrient quantities.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Food expenditure per adult equivalent (US dollars per quarter)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Nutrient content of purchased food (carbohydrates, protein, fat in grams per adult equivalent)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Hedonic valuation of macronutrients: willingness to pay per unit of carbohydrate, protein, and fat content, allowing heterogeneity across meat-dairy, prepared, and other food categories
claim_object.target_population: US households in Nielsen Homescan panel 2005-2006, in Fresh Foods panel, purchasing in 5+ of 9 food categories per quarter

baseline_specs.label: Table6-US-IV-interacted
baseline_specs.notes: Coefficients from coef_us.out parameter file; Table 6 column IV9 in paper. Protein and fat coefficients are interacted with category indicators: meats-dairy (C4,C5), prepared (C9), other.

constraints.notes: No demographic controls in baseline; all variation is absorbed by HH-category FE. Specification variation comes from: (1) OLS vs IV, (2) interacted vs pooled nutrient coefficients, (3) country samples, (4) income/calorie subsamples, (5) category groupings, (6) FE structure.

data_sources.included_data: Only estimated parameter files (.out) are included in the replication package. No micro data.

calibration_sources.coefficients: DoFiles/Simulations/parameters/coef_us.out (7 beta coefficients from US IV regression)

notes: This paper estimates a structural food demand model. The replication package contains only do-files and estimated parameter outputs, not the proprietary scanner data. Synthetic panel data is constructed calibrated to the reported category-level means and estimated coefficients. The specification search varies: OLS vs IV, nutrient subsets, category interactions, sample restrictions (dropping categories), and FE/clustering.
